body: All, [Sarith](http://www.grasshopper3d.com/profile/sarith) will post a discussion at some point next week with more details but meanwhile I wanted to let you know about the new set of components that he is developing for lighting simulation with Honeybee. The components are fairly advanced. They will replace IES>HB workflow and will open up a lot of new possibilities. Here is couple of outputs that are created by the components: [](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10361848/12082848/18c28616-b267-11e5-869e-ecf5f3a01eb9.jpg) [](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10361848/12082854/22674d82-b267-11e5-9f81-0975a1958060.jpg) [](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10361848/12082870/434b5f34-b267-11e5-8878-0930b3405880.jpg) You can see more images here: [https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/pull/445#issuecomment-...](https://github.com/mostaphaRoudsari/Honeybee/pull/445#issuecomment-168571005) The components are ready to be tested. If you update Honeybee you should be able to see them under WIP tab. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/088*6UBF7TCRkJoyWKA9oehfOQ0MGOKWbjGy4ui7-KWjKxPnToW9awNRj7ZZe3lF6mdQZqTFMk2BDGdGQYlAzS7mJVz7aSRN/IESComponents.png) He put an example file together which you can download [from Hydra](http://hydrashare.github.io/hydra/viewer?owner=sariths&fork=hydra&id=IES_indoor_Electric_Lighting&slide=0&scale=4&offset=-2124.612590189635,-1442.713159528839). Give it a try and let us know if you have any feedback. Cheers, Mostapha
